alert.note: Alert for Amador; El Dorado; Sacramento (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 3:29AM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Cosumnes River At Michigan Bar affecting Amador, El Dorado and Sacramento Counties. .Recent rains combined with an incoming storm will result in significant rises for the rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cosumnes River at Michigan Bar. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low lying lands along the river begin to flood. At 12.0 feet, Water flows on to the road near Wilton. At 13.2 feet, Water floods houses in Wilton. The south bank levee near Wilton is overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to 14.0 feet just after midnight tonight. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 02/01/1963. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued around 9 AM PDT.
